decks.notes: This deck is an Aggro - Affinity archetype in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format. Its key concept revolves around playing low-cost artifact creatures, such as Ornithopter, Gingerbrute, and Thraben Inspector, to quickly build a board presence. Moon-Circuit Hacker, Kenku Artificer, Frogmite, and Myr Enforcer also contribute to this strategy. The deck utilizes artifact synergies with cards like Springleaf Drum and Metallic Rebuke to control the board and protect its threats. Additionally, it aims to draw extra cards with Thoughtcast and Of One Mind while boosting its creatures' power with All That Glitters.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent. It achieves this by utilizing low-cost creatures with haste, such as Goblin Bushwhacker and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The inclusion of cards like Voldaren Epicure and Lotus Petal allows the deck to maintain its speed and efficiency. Kuldotha Rebirth and Experimental Synthesizer provide additional sources of creatures to attack with. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of fast and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and spells. The deck focuses on maximizing the effectiveness of cheap spells like Delver of Secrets, Thought Scour, and Mental Note to quickly fill the graveyard and reduce the cost of Cryptic Serpent and Tolarian Terror. It also includes a variety of countermagic like Force Spike, Spell Pierce, and Counterspell to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck further enhances its card advantage and staying power with draw spells like Brainstorm, Deep Analysis, and Lórien Revealed.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early aggression and maintain board control using low-cost, efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and life total through a combination of creature damage and direct damage from cards such as Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Vampire Sovereign. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Cuombajj Witches and Chittering Rats helps disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Witch's Cottage to further disrupt the opponent and provide value.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Urzatron lands to generate massive amounts of mana and play large creatures. The key concept is to assemble the Urzatron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, and Urza's Power Plant) using cards like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings. Once all three Urzatron lands are in play, the deck can generate enough mana to cast powerful creatures like Ulamog's Crusher and Maelstrom Colossus. Other cards like Self-Assembler and Wretched Gryff help to accelerate the deck's game plan. Control elements in the form of Fiery Cannonade and Breath Weapon help to deal with opposing threats.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using a low-cost creature lineup. The deck focuses on playing cheap creature cards like Slumbering Keepguard, Deftblade Elite, and Healer's Hawk to quickly build a board presence. The deck then enhances these creatures with a variety of enchantments such as Cartouche of Solidarity, Ethereal Armor, and Sentinel's Eyes to make them stronger and harder to deal with. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of small but powerful creatures and to keep them on the defensive throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to exert control over the game using a combination of removal spells, graveyard manipulation, and card advantage. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies and maintaining card advantage through cards like Shelob's Ambush, Reckoner's Bargain, and Rowan's Grim Search. Additionally, it utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Moan of the Unhallowed. The deck also includes a semi-aggro element with cards like Gurmag Angler and Sweettooth Witch. The mana base consists largely of Swamps to facilitate the casting of its spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures. The deck focuses on playing creatures like Quirion Ranger, Nettle Sentinel, Skarrgan Pit-Skulk, and Experiment One to establish board presence early on. The deck also utilizes cards like Burning-Tree Emissary, Nest Invader, and Halo Hopper to generate additional creatures and maintain pressure. To maximize damage, the deck includes Savage Swipe and Vines of Vastwood as removal and combat tricks. Lastly, Elven Farsight and Rancor provide additional support for the creatures, while Forests serve as the main source of mana.

The main concept of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to apply consistent pressure on the opponent by combining efficient creatures with removal spells and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Chainer's Edict and Cast Down while drawing extra cards with Night's Whisper. It also utilizes the flicker effect of Ephemerate and Glint Hawk to reuse enter-the-battlefield triggers and generate additional value. All That Glitters is used to pump up creatures and deal large amounts of damage. The deck has a strong emphasis on creature synergy and disruption to overwhelm the opponent.
